result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse S Drews

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jesse S Drews not in court.  Attorney Kathryn E. Keizer in court for Jesse S Drews.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Jesse S Drews in court.  Attorney Kathryn E. Keizer in court for Jesse S Drews.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney recently appointed. Victim is present but does not wish to make statement. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Defendant Jesse S Drews in court.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jason Daane for defendant. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): A.M.S. 5-1-1991 OR RESIDENCE. If defendant and victim(s) are living together, defendant may go to their residence once with a police officer to retrieve the defendant's personal belongings. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Jesse S Drews in court, in custody via video.  Attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for State of Wisconsin.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jason Daane for bond purposes. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Defendant qualifies for SPD. State is in compliance with victim's rights. Signature bond set. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

The original document was titled: Notice of Arrest
The original history event date is: 08-25-2022
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
